pullRequest.body:
Currently `Algebra.Polynomial.RingDivision` is a strange mix of basic results about polynomial rings and stuff about their roots. We move those to a new file `Algebra.Polynomial.Roots`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô

---

You can run this locally as follows
```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
You should be able to also remove the `style-exception.txt` entry for `Algebra.Polynomial.RingDivision`.

> You should be able to also remove the `style-exception.txt` entry for `Algebra.Polynomial.RingDivision`.

Good catch, thanks!

I think a 900+ line file is still a bit too long. Though I don't have a sensible way to split `Algebra.Polynomial.Roots` up :(
Anyway the split itself looks great and it is quite an improvement. Thanks!

> I think a 900+ line file is still a bit too long. Though I don't have a sensible way to split `Algebra.Polynomial.Roots` up :( Anyway the split itself looks great and it is quite an improvement. Thanks!

Actually I spotted a couple of lemmas in `RingDivision` that can be in `Roots`. Now the two files are essentially of the same length, and `Roots` starts with the definition of `Polynomial.roots`. This seems quite good.
maintainer merge

Should we have this line twice? Or should it only be in this file, because importing this file is the moral equivalent of importing `ring_division` in Lean3.
We should have the line twice, you are right. Thanks!
Indeed we already have it twice!
